question: Okay, I'm going, I'm going. Jesus... Hello, Heather.
answer: Veronica. Finally. Got a paper of Kurt Kelly's. I need you to forge a hot and horny but realistically low-key note in Kurt's handwriting and we'll slip it into Martha Dumptruck's lunch tray.

question: Shit, Heather. I don't have anything against Martha Dunnstock.
answer: You don't have anything for her either. Come on, it'll be Very. The note'll give her shower nozzle masturbation material for weeks.

question: I'll think about it.
answer: Don't think. Splendid. I'll dictate. Veronica needs something to write on. Heather, bend over. How nice. Two assholes Heather Duke, back down. Dear Martha, you're so sweet..

question: Sorry Veronica.
answer: Betty Finn. Gosh..... I'm really sorry I couldn't make it to your birthday party last month.

question: That's okay. Your Mom said you had a big date. Heck, I'd probably skip my own birthday party for a date.
answer: Don't say that.

question: Oh Ronnie, you have to look at what I dug up the other day.
answer: I was talking with someone!

question: Color me impressed. I thought you grew out of Betty Finn.
answer: Oh great. Here comes Heather.

question: Hi Courtney. Love your blouse. Ooh, let me snare a tater.
answer: Thanks. I just got it last night at the Limited. Totally blew my allowance.

question: You wanted to become a member of the most powerful clique in the school. If I wasn't already the head of it, I'd want the same thing.
answer: I'm sorry? What are you oozing about?

question: That episode with the note back there was for all of us to enjoy, but you're determined to ruin my day.
answer: We made a girl want to consider suicide. What a scream. What a jest.

question: What are you going to do, Heather? Take the two shots or send me out?
answer: Did you have a brain tumor for breakfast? First you ask if you can be red, knowing that I'm always red...

question: Shit.
answer: Damn. It's your turn Heather.

question: No, it's Heather's turn.
answer: Anyway, I can say never to high school. I've got David.

question: I don't know, it was okay, I guess.
answer: Hey kid, isn't the prom coming up?

question: I guess.
answer: Any contestants worth mentioning?

question: Dear Diary, I want to kill and you have to believe.....damn pen! You have to believe it's for more than selfish reasons. More than a spoke in my menstrual cycle. You have to believe me.
answer: So, are you a cheerleader?

question: No, not at all.
answer: You're pretty enough to be one.

question: Gee, thanks.
answer: It's so great to be able to talk to a girl and not have to ask "What's your major?" I hate that. So when you go to college, what kind of subjects do you think you'll study?

question: So what do you say we head up to my room and have a real party. I've got the best Windham Hill C.D. collection in the dorm. You're kidding. That pecker actually scored something on his own? Excellent. Veronica, ever do cocaine?
answer: Ever since Phil Collins did that MTV anti-drug commercial I refuse everything.

question: Phil Collins? Are you sure he isn't drinking and driving?
answer: Jeez, right, then why don't I do drugs?

question: Seventeen is the last year Mom buys the Twinkies. When you make the jump from working weekends at Pizza Hut to thirty years at I.B.M., you lose something. Not innocence--power. J.F.K.! Christ, I can't explain it, but I'm allowed an understanding that my parents and these Remington University assholes have chosen to ignore. I understand I must stop Heather.
answer: How's my little cheerleader? Now I know everyone at your high school isn't so uptight, come on.

question: Hey really, I don't feel so great.
answer: Let's do it on the coats. It'll be excellent.

question: I have a little prepared speech I give when my suitor wants more than I'd like to give him.... Gee Blank, I had a nice....
answer: Save the speeches for Malcom X. I just wanna get laid.

question: Betty Finn was a true friend and I sold her out for a bunch of Swatchdogs and Diet Cokeheads. Killing Heather'd be like offing the Wicked Witch of the West. Or is it East? West! I sound like a psycho. Tomorrow I'll be kissing her aerobicized ass but tonight let me dream of a world without Heather. A world where I am free.
answer: You stupid cunt!

question: You goddamn bitch!
answer: You were nothing before you met me! You were playing Barbies with Betty Finn! You were a Brownie, you were a Bluebird, you were a Girl Scout Cookie! I got you into a Remington Party! What's my thanks? It's on the hallway carpet. I get paid in puke!

question: Lick it up, baby. Lick. It. Up.
answer: Monday morning, you're history. I'll tell everyone about tonight. Transfer to Washington. Transfer to Jefferson. No one at Westerburg's going to let you play their reindeer games.

question: S'okay.... Sure. But I'm Blue.
answer: Goddamn, no wonder you looked so mangled when I came through the window.

question: I've always treated Heather's teen queen power plays as bullshit..... But I'm really scared. Who am I going to eat lunch with on Monday? I sound like an Afterschool Special.
answer: That was my first game of Strip Croquet, you know. I thank you.

question: You're welcome. It's a lot more interesting than just flinging off your clothes and boning away on the neighbor's swing set.
answer: Well, I don't know. There's something to be said for...Ouch!

question: What a night. What a life. I almost moved into high school out of sixth grade because I was some genius. We all decided to chuck the idea because I'd have trouble making friends, blah-blah-blah. Now blah-blah-blah is all I do. I use my grand I.Q. to figure out what gloss to wear and how to hit three keggers before curfew. Some genius. Killing her won't solve anything. Well then, I'll pray for rain. Hey, it was good for me too, Sparky. There's a big difference between the most popular girl in the school and dead sperm. I know exactly what the hell you're talking about and you're right, you don't know what the hell you're talking about. Let's just grow up, be adults, and die. But before that, I'd like to see Heather Chandler puke her guts out.
answer: Bag that. Lingo this.

question: Trust me. She skips the Saturday morning trip to Grandma's even when she's not hungover. What about orange juice and milk? What's the upchuck factor on that? Don't be a dick. That stuff'll kill her. O-kay. We'll cook up some soup and put it in a Coke. Sick, eh? Now should it be Chicken-Noodle or Bean-with-Bacon? What are you doing? You just can't go.....Besides, she'd never drink anything that looks like that. Just give me a cup, jerk. Milk and orange juice. Hmmmm. Maybe we could cough a phlegm globber in it or something. No luck? Well, milk and orange juice'll do quite nicely. Quite nicely. You're not funny. Bonehead. Morning, Heather.
answer: Veronica. And Jesse James. Quelle surprise. Hear about Veronica's affection for regurgitation?

question: We both said a lot of things we didn't mean, last night.
answer: Did we? How the hell'd you get in here? Did you put a phlegm globber in it or something? I'm not drinking that piss. Intense? Grow up. You think I'll drink it just because you call me chicken. Just give me the cup, jerk. Corn nuts!

question: Any other Principal would take the same position. Keep things business as usual. I let the kids go before lunch and the switchboard'll light up like a Christmas Tree.
answer: I find it profoundly disturbing that we are told of a tragic destruction of youth and all we can talk about is adequate mourning times and misused vocabulary words.

question: Oh Christ.
answer: The school, meaning both students and teachers, must revel in this revealing moment. I suggest we get everyone into the cafeteria and just talk. And feel. Together.

question: Thank you, Ms. Fleming. Call me when the shuttle lands...Now is this Heather the cheerleader? Damn. I'd be willing to go half a day for a cheerleader. Done. I hate Mondays.
answer: I said a circle you imbeciles! Forget it! Just sit down. I'm just so thrilled to be given an example of everything I've taught you. That example is Heather Chandler. I have the note! I'll pass the suicide note around the room so you can feel its tragic beauty for yourself. Let us share together the feelings the suicide has spurred in us all. Who wants to begin? Now, now, we're not here to rehash the coroner's report. Let's talk emotions.

question: Yeah, where's your urge to purge?
answer: Fuck it.

question: Look, heather left behind one of her Swatches. She'd want you to have it, Veronica. She always said you couldn't accessorize for shit.
answer: What a waste. Oh the Humanity.

question: Hello. My Mom's making my favorite meal tonight. Spaghetti. Lots of oregano. Right.
answer: Take a break Veronica, sit down.

question: All right.
answer: So what was the first day after Heather's suicide like?

question: Hi. I'm sorry. Technically I didn't kill Heather Chandler but hey, who am I trying to kid, right? I just want my high school to be a nice place. Amen. Did that sound bitchy?
answer: Veronica. What are you doing tonight?

question: Mourning. Maybe watch some T.V. Why?
answer: Ram asked me out, but he wants to double with Kurt and Kurt doesn't have a date.

question: Heather, I've got something going with J.D.
answer: Please Veronica. Put Billy the Kid on hold tonight, I'll never forget it.

question: We on tonight man?
answer: I still got to talk to Heather, dude. Weird funeral, huh?

question: Pretty weird. That pudwapper just stepped on my foot.
answer: Let's kick his ass.

question: Cool off, we're seniors.
answer: Goddamn Geek!

question: Is it sleeping, dude?
answer: I think so, man.

question: Then get over on my side. Oh shit, cowtipping is the fucking greatest.
answer: Punch it in!

question: Count of three, guy. "When I get that feeling, I need sexual healing....."
answer: Yeah, right, asshole. I'm doing a favor for Heather. A double date. I tried to tell you at the funeral but you rode off.

question: "Feel like making bah da dah bah da dah, feel like making love."
answer: So what? Don't smile like that, Jesus!

question: Hi Guys. I came to check on this week's lunchtime poll topic. Oh. Sure. The what? I don't know. This thing leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
answer: Like last night, Veronica?

question: I'm sorry? I don't get it.
answer: You did last night.

question: Yeah. And? I left him drunk and flailing in cowshit.
answer: I don't know. He was really detailed.

question: Hi Guys. Glad you could make it.
answer: So do we just start fucking?

question: I've made a circle on each end of the clearing. Ram, you come over here. When you get in the circle, strip.
answer: What about you?

question: I was hoping you'd rip my clothes off me, sport.
answer: Oh. Good idea.

question: Keep going until you hit the clearing! Call in! I heard something out there. I'm checking it out.
answer: VERONICA and J.D. somersault into the backseat and begin taking off their clothes. VERONICA and J.D., stripped down to their underwear, embrace.

question: Think what I heard was just a stinking owl. All I got is two kids making out in the backseat of a car. Should I pry them apart?
answer: Seeing the cop move away. VERONICA and J.D. stop kissing. They catch their breath, smile, then continue passionately necking.

question: Yes. Yes. We'll work something out. I swear to God. Won't we J.D.?...J.D.? You shoulda stuck around, jerk. Ms. Fleming wants to redefine the high school experience. Don't even talk about that stuff! You can be so immature!
answer: We beat the bitches.

question: Oh beautiful. The Beaver's home.
answer: Judge told em to slurp shit and die. I put a Norwegian in the boiler room. Masterful. When that blew, it set off a pack of thermals I'd stuck upstairs. It's great to be alive!

question: Let me get it clear, Veronica. You want yourself a sweet homeboy for this T.V. show so you can show everybody what a loose, Martin Luther Cosby-lovng place Westerburg is.
answer: Something like that. Will you do it?

question: Damn, you're a shrewd one. Shrewd.
answer: I just want to show different kinds of people can get together and it doesn't have to be Vietnam. You don't get treated badly here do you?

question: I don't get treated at all, but hey, don't worry about it. I'll do your thing. It'll give my Mom a smile.
answer: Things are going to change, Earl.

question: Hello, Betty.....
answer: I don't believe it. I'm winning.

question: Don't get cocky, girl.
answer: I missed you. I know I'm not as, as exciting as your other friends.

question: That's bullshit. Just shoot.
answer: Ronnie, I'm still a virgin.

question: Shoot. Betty, your daydreams are a lot better than my realities, believe me. I'm afraid though it's time to get your butt kicked.
answer: Ronnie! Hey, you're not settling for the two shots are you? Knock me out girl. It's the only way.

question: It's not my style, okay?
answer: Nice guys finish last. I should know.

question: So did you call people to tell them how to get to the studio tonight?
answer: Back off. I called everyone, even that Stoner slut. Felt like giving my phone a bath. I told Betty just now...Damn!

question: You're so polluted. Talking down to people, making fake notes....
answer: I don't see what gives you the right to lecture, Ronnie. You were soulmates with Betty Finn until you realized you're the cover of Seventeen magazine and she's the before half of a Scarsdale Diet ad. Some people just don't matter. Why should those who do carry their weight? Am I right?

question: Ah please sit down. I got a confession to make. My name used to be Heather, too.
answer: But my name's not...

question: People just don't take the name Heather seriously. They should, shouldn't they?
answer: I'm so sorry. I was led to believe there were going to be different kinds of social and psychological types at this gathering.

question: I said I was sorry.
answer: You are out of control. Heather and Kurt were a shock, but Martha Dumptruck, get crucial! She dialed suicide hotlines in her diapers.

question: You're not funny. Ouch!
answer: What. A. Martyr. Understand; Martha couldn't take the heat so she got out of the kitchen. Just think what a better place the world would be if every nimrod followed her cue.

question: Just shut up and turn on the radio. Hot Probs is on.
answer: Oh shit, yeah. This sounds like a good one.

question: Fucking child protector caps. Give me a break. What are you trying to do? Kill me?
answer: What were you trying to do? Sleep?

question: Suicide is a private thing.
answer: You're giving your life away to become a goddamn statistic in U.S. Fucking A Today. That's got to be the least private thing I can think of.

question: But what about Heather and Ram and Kurt?
answer: If everyone jumped off a bridge, young lady, would you?

question: Probably....
answer: Hey now, if you were happy every day of your life, you wouldn't be a human being, you'd be a game show host.

question: Let's knock off early. Go to the mall. Something lame like that.
answer: Sure.

question: Heather?
answer: Veronica! Color me stoked, girl. I've gotten everyone to sign this petition even the one who think BigFun are tuneless Eurofags. People love me! My God, you haven't signed!

question: People love you but I know you. Jennifer Forbes told me the petition she signed was to put a jacuzzi in the cafeteria. And Doug Hylton...
answer: So some people need different kinds of "convincing" than others.... Hey, just sign the petition!

question: Don't talk to me like that.
answer: It was J.D.'s idea! He made out the signature sheet and everything. Now will you sign it?

question: No.
answer: Jealous much?

question: Heather, why can't you just be a friend? Why are you such a MegaBitch?
answer: Because I can be! The same fucking cheek, goddamnit! Why are you pulling my dick? Do you think, do you really think, if Betty Finn's fairy godmother made her Cool, she'd still act nice and hang with her dweebette friends? No way! Uh-Uh!

question: Is this turnout weak or what? I had at least seventy more people at my funeral.
answer: Heather? Wha...

question: Oh God Veronica, my afterlife is s-o-o boring. If I have to sing "Kumbaya" one more time...
answer: What are you doing here?!

question: VERONICA hugs J.F.K. the cat then rips down the hanging Barbie.
answer: Does she want a written invitation? Veronica! Dinner!

question: J.D. crawls through VERONICA's window. Hanging from the rafter, neck in a noose of bedshoots, is VERONICA.
answer: Honey?

question: J.D. paces the room, sweating and ranting, waving a gun in one hand, the Barbie doll in the other.
answer: Honey, are you all right in there? Oh God, I knew it! No, no! I want my baby back! I should have let you keep that job at the mall. I was just afraid of you coming home alone at night! I made your favorite! Spaghetti! Lots of oregano!

question: Get a job. Rodney, where's everybody going?
answer: It's Friday.....

question: Oh my God, the damn pep assembly....
answer: Yeah, these things are pretty artificial, but at least we all get out of class...

question: Rodney, what's underneath the gym?
answer: The boiler room.
